questions.question: At a local high school, GPA's are normally distributed with a mean of 2.9 and standard deviation of 0.6. What percentage of students at the high school have a GPA between 2.3 and 3.5?

explanations.a: Let X denote the GPA, therefore P(X in (2.3,3.5))=P(X in (-1,1))=phi(1)-phi(-1)=0.6826=68%.
explanations.b: Let X denote the GPA, therefore P(X in (2.3,3.5))=P(X in (-1,1))=phi(1)-phi(-1)=0.6826=68%.
explanations.c: Let X denote the GPA, therefore P(X in (2.3,3.5))=P(X in (-1,1))=phi(1)-phi(-1)=0.6826=68%.
explanations.d: Let X denote the GPA, therefore P(X in (2.3,3.5))=P(X in (-1,1))=phi(1)-phi(-1)=0.6826=68%.

questions.question: A mobile conversation follows a exponential distribution f (x) = (1/3)e-x/3. What is the probability that the conversation takes more than 5 minutes is?

explanations.a: f(x) = (1/3)e^(-x/3). The call should last more than 5 minutes so integrating from 5 till infinity we get the required probability = e^(-5/3).
explanations.b: f(x) = (1/3)e^(-x/3). The call should last more than 5 minutes so integrating from 5 till infinity we get the required probability = e^(-5/3).
explanations.c: f(x) = (1/3)e^(-x/3). The call should last more than 5 minutes so integrating from 5 till infinity we get the required probability = e^(-5/3).
explanations.d: f(x) = (1/3)e^(-x/3). The call should last more than 5 minutes so integrating from 5 till infinity we get the required probability = e^(-5/3).
